sentence.Network_en: Several thousand supporters strained to catch a glimpse of the new president.
sentence.Network_cn: 几千名支持者翘首企盼能一睹新总统的风采。

sentence.Network_en: Crowds shouted and pushed to get a glimpse of their hero.
sentence.Network_cn: 为了一睹英雄的风采，人群喊叫着，推搡着。

sentence.Network_en: Below us you could glimpse the rooftops of a few small villages.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们可以瞥见脚下一些小村庄的屋顶。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'shine faintly'): probably of Germanic origin; related to Middle High German glimsen, also to glimmer

entry.def: If you get a glimpse of someone or something, you see them very briefly and not very well.

example.ex: Some of the fans had waited 24 hours outside the Hyde Park Hotel to catch a glimpse of their heroine.
example.tran: 为了一睹女主角的风采，一些追星族已经在海德公园饭店外守候了24个小时。

entry.def: If you glimpse someone or something, you see them very briefly and not very well.

example.ex: She glimpsed a group of people standing on the bank of a river.
example.tran: 她瞥见一群人站在河岸边。

entry.tran: 短暂的感受；初步的认识
entry.def: A glimpse of something is a brief experience of it or an idea about it that helps you understand or appreciate it better.

example.ex: As university campuses become increasingly multi-ethnic, they offer a glimpse of the conflicts society will face tomorrow.
example.tran: 大学校园变得日益多种族化，通过校园可以对未来社会将要面对的诸多冲突有一个初步的认识。

sentences.sentence: "from the window he could catch a glimpse of the lake"
"he caught only a glimpse of the professor's meaning"

means.word_mean: 1. catch a glimpse of or see briefly;

sentences.sentence: "We glimpsed the Queen as she got into her limousine"

auth_sentence.content: The Olympics allowed us to glimpse this potential being realised.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Olympics allowed us to glimpse this potential being realised.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Olympics allowed us to glimpse this potential being realised.

auth_sentence.content: You might even catch a glimpse of a gold medallist.
auth_sentence.res_content: You might even catch a glimpse of a gold medallist.

auth_sentence.content: Quantum entanglement affords an initial glimpse of this.

Sentence.sentence: Saddest of all is when children catch a glimpse of the masked fire fighter but hide because they think they have seen a monster.
In a sense, we are already getting a glimpse of what's to come.

sentences.en: I glimpsed her among the crowd just now.
sentences.cn: 我刚才看到她在人群里。

sentences.en: I glimpsed a rat running past.
sentences.cn: 我看到一只老鼠跑过去了。

sentences.en: One glimpse at himself in the mirror was enough.
sentences.cn: 让他照着镜子看自己一眼就够了。

sentences.en: She catches a glimpse of a car in the distance.
sentences.cn: 她一眼就瞥见了远处的汽车。

sentences.en: Do you want a glimpse of the future of our education?
sentences.cn: 你想大致了解下我们的教育吗？

jushi.english: I glimpsed her among the crowd just now.
jushi.chinese: 我刚才看到她在人群里。
